question.questionText: What is the evidence in this experiment that OJ1 or OJ2 had more acid?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The syringe for OJ1 rose higher because OJ1 produced more gas, so OJ1 has more acid than OJ2.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: The syringe popped up higher.
The evidence is that OJ1 has a higher dot.
The evidence is that it has more in the syringe.
The evidence is carbon dioxide.
OJ1 has more acid because the dot is higher than OJ2's dot.

The plunger went higher which means there is more acid.

Because the acid made OJ1 go up higher than the OJ2 in the tube.
Because OJ1 is higher up than OJ2 so that means it has more acid.
The evidence is that water has a higher concentration of acid.
